DOC.HEAD: Soybean Futures Droop; Grains Close Mixed
DOC.TEXT: Soybean futures prices settled moderately lower Friday on the Chicago Board of Trade in quiet, sporadic trading. The grain markets finished mixed in the shortened pre-holiday session. Analysts said the soybean complex was dominated by one large trade house that was seeking to press the price for March delivery below $5.88 a bushel, and by independent ``local'' traders who were sellers in the soybean meal market. March soybeans finished at $5.85} a bushel. Wheat settled slightly lower but the corn and oat markets were nearly unchanged in extremely quiet trading with many traders absent because of the sub-zero weather in Chicago or the upcoming holiday weekend. The markets will reopen on Tuesday. Wheat futures settled { cent to 1{ cents lower with the contract for delivery in March at $4.11} a bushel; corn futures were unchanged to } cent higher with March at $2.39 a bushel; oats were \ cent lower to \ cent higher with March at $1.54\ a bushel; soybeans were 2\ cents to 3 cents lower with January at $5.72\ a bushel.
